result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Makel R Lampkin

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court.  Attorney Jason Findling in court on behalf of Arial Jade Rosenberg for Makel R Lampkin.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests resolution date. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Makel R Lampkin.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense requests another status date to determine case posture. Court grants requests. Court adjourns matter for a status. Case remains calendared in Br. 11
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel previously received a copy of the Information and waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense has received partial discovery.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Makel R Lampkin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Shipman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defense given a copy.  Case is adjourned to Judge Franke.  Arraignment scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JP.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
JusticePoint supervision Level 3.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Makel Lampkin in custody.   Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge Franke, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER HAS PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Makel Lampkin in custody.   Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed doctor report and do not contest findings. State, defense and defendant waive right to hearing. Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Arguments heard as to bail. Defense requests a preliminary hearing date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; LAMPKIN REPORT

Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court, defendant Makel R Lampkin not in court, in custody.  Alex Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Doctor reviewing the case has requested more time to complete evaluation and report.   Matter remains calendared in Branch 25.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter from Matthew T. Seipel, Ph.D., dated June 2, 2022 - received

-signed and filed. 
Clerk provided information to Wisconsin Forensic Unit.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Makel R Lampkin in Court with Attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Makel R Lampkin in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.** 
Case in Court for Initial Appearance. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.
Defendant given a copy of the Criminal Complaint, and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel, and right to a Preliminary hearing. Court reviewed Criminal Complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings. COURT RAISED COMPETENCY. 
Court found that there is reason to believe the Defendant is not competent to proceed. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered Defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. 
Case adjourned for Doctor's Report Return, Branch 28.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room 608 of the Courthouse.

DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
COURT TOLLED TIME LIMITS FOR PRELIMINARY HEARING.
